channel.title: Still a helpful community?
channel.description:
I've been browsing this board for quite a while now (both as guest and as registered user), and to be honest, it's disappointing to see how many people that ask for help get denied. A typical comment on a question I saw was
If you can't use the search button, just go and die
A not so typical comment, yet still not helpful was:
FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK V FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK V FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK V FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK FAK V
Ok, I can understand that it is slightly annoying to see that you've put so much troube into posting that sticky, or making it clear enough that you simply can't miss it. And YET they still ask dumb questions. But, you gotta see it from their perspective too, they are people that maybe never worked with forum software before and just want to get a answer fast. If you think about it, is it really that hard to just paste the url of that topic? Instead of thinking of a new way to clearify that the forum has a search button etc.. So, do you still consider this community to be a helpful and "noob - friendly" community? Discuss.

item.title: Still a helpful community?

@Xerxes wrote:

item.title: Still a helpful community?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Stfu everyone, stick to the topic or flame each other on MSN k, thx.

Yea, I agree with Miss Silabsoft. It just gets people pissed when they have to repeat. We have stickies and everything yet the same questions are being asked over and over again. It’s called searchnd read. If your illeterate then nobody can help you. shifty

Literacy are important everyone1!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Still a helpful community?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

its not that we arnt helpful its the fact that we all have limits and after a few hundred repetitive questions answered over and over again your limit is broken and you start to just not give a crap about people who cant take the time to read how to fix a simple javac error, or the people that try to run a private server without the pure basics of programming. see that enough times and you wouldnt give a shit about other peoples problems either

I like your new rule, by the way.
I’ll start linking people to that, and also to this:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

And YET they still ask dumb questions. But, you gotta see it from their perspective too, they are people that maybe never worked with forum software before and just want to get a answer fast.
If you think about it, is it really that hard to just paste the url of that topic? Instead of thinking of a new way to clearify that the forum has a search button etc…

So, do you still consider this community to be a helpful and “noob - friendly” community? Discuss.[/quote]

item.title: Still a helpful community?
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

[quote=“kmb, post:26, topic:6742”]The fact is: The more new people join, the more stupid questions we will get.

I have suggested Mopar to make some basic questions for the new users before they are able to register (and post). Too bad our leader lacks the needed PHP skills.[/quote]

HAHAHAHAHAA!!!

I can see it now, people posting on other forums looking for

“moparisthebest.com cheats”

“I cnt get in moparistreyhbest.com ne1 got hax so i can get n?”

Read full topic

item.title: Still a helpful community?
item.dc:creator: @WhiteShadow WhiteShadow
item.description:
@WhiteShadow wrote:

This forum is semi user friendly enough IMO. (In my opinion) Just that the over population of beginers is at a very high bar. To hard to handle at times. I myself, like to be nice to everybody because hey, everyones been a noob once. But man some just make me burn in fire. (Which I try not to expose). So… beginers please cooperate, read carefully, and search. Semi non beginers watch what you type or you will be labeled flamer…

I like alot of noobs that ask silly questions, then the mid lvled scripters that think they’re all that and go around flamming people.

I don’t know, I just felt like saying this, atm.

Read full topic

I have suggested Mopar to make some basic questions for the new users before they are able to register (and post). Too bad our leader lacks the needed PHP skills.
[/quote]
i think we have more stupid posts than questions[/quote]

It’s not the quantity that matters it’s the lack of quality in the questions.
